alert.note: Alert for Northern Columbia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 22 at 2:21AM EDT until June 22 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of the Suwannee Valley of northern Florida and portions of inland southeast Georgia, including the following areas, in northern Florida, Hamilton, Northern Columbia, Southern Columbia and Suwannee. In southeast Georgia, Echols. * WHEN...Through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has extended a Flood Watch for portions of the Suwannee Valley of northern Florida and for portions of inland southeast Georgia through Friday evening. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches, with locally higher amounts, are expected through Friday. These heavy rainfall totals over saturated soil conditions may lead to flooding, particularly at urban and normally flood prone, low lying areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
